details.excerpt: ![By shadowkill](http://bd7a65e2cb448908f934-86a50c88e47af9e1fb58ce0672b5a500.r32.cf3.rackcdn.com/uploads/assets/legacy/Puzzlecolorrubiks263269l.jpg)Last week was another 4-days week because of Easter Monday. So what happened?
details.content:
Last week was another 4-days week because of Easter Monday. So what happened?

The week started off for the whole team with the ODI Brand Tech team workshop: a great excercise to distill our core values and flesh out what we believe the ODI stands for.

Stuart worked a bit more on bringing the office calendar into production as well as make the development path of the ODI website "a bit more sane".

James and Sam made the member's directory available; the link, at the moment, remains a placeholder until more content shows up.

Jeni worked on the Open Data Certificate and got some really good feedback.

I spent some of my time with the newly released R 3.0.0 and added a list of editorial comments to the W3C Data Cube vocabulary.

Lastly, a great 80s fad is back with the Rubik's Cube making frequent appearances in our office. If you want to get started, the internet hosts oodles of guides â€“ perhaps one of the more visual explanations comes from the New York Times.
